Motor Trafic (Amendment) Act, No. 20 of 1968 b. DW. 23/66. An AcT To AMEND THE Motor Trarric Act. [Date of Assent: June 11, 1968] BE it enacted by the Queen's Most Excellent Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate and
1@ House of Representatives of Ceylon in this present Parliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, as follows: —
1, This Act may be cited as the Motor Traffic shore tte, (Amendment) Act, No, 20 of 1968.

2. The Motor Traffic Act is hereby amended by Invation of the insertion, immediately after section 156, of the ex ssstion following new section which shall have effect as section Chester 200, 156 of that Act:—
Riding in 1864. No conductor of an omnibus on

canibnte highwey shall permit any passenger to ride, and no passenger shall ride, in any omnibus except in a seat provided for the use of passengers or in the gangway provided between two rows of seats in a single-decked omnibus, or in the gangway provided between two rows of seats in the lower deck of a double- decked omnibus. *”.
